alert.note: Alert for Allen; Neosho; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 8:58AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Wilson, northern Neosho, southern Woodson and southern Allen Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 857 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chanute, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chanute, Humboldt, Erie, St. Paul, Toronto, Buffalo, Walnut, Savonburg, Elsmore, Benedict, Stark, Earlton, Coyville, Toronto Lake, Batesville, Petrolia, Rose, Chanute Airport, and Cross Timbers State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
